https://github.com/PrefectHQ/prefect.description: Prefect is a workflow orchestration framework for building resilient data pipelines in Python.

https://github.com/StackStorm/st2.description: StackStorm (aka "IFTTT for Ops") is event-driven automation for auto-remediation, incident responses, troubleshooting, deployments, and more for DevOps and SREs. Includes rules engine, workflow, 160 integration packs with 6000+ actions (see https://exchange.stackstorm.org) and ChatOps. Installer at https://docs.stackstorm.com/install/index.html

https://github.com/ansible-semaphore/sem.description: Modern UI and powerful API for Ansible, Terraform/OpenTofu/Terragrunt, PowerShell and other DevOps tools.

https://github.com/ansible/awx.description: AWX provides a web-based user interface, REST API, and task engine built on top of Ansible. It is one of the upstream projects for Red Hat Ansible Automation Platform.

https://github.com/apache/airflow.description: Apache Airflow - A platform to programmatically author, schedule, and monitor workflows

https://github.com/dagster-io/dagster.description: An orchestration platform for the development, production, and observation of data assets.

https://github.com/diggerhq/digger.description: Digger is an open source IaC orchestration tool. Digger allows you to run IaC in your existing CI pipeline ‚ö°Ô∏è

https://github.com/gruntwork-io/terragru.description: Terragrunt is a flexible orchestration tool that allows Infrastructure as Code written in OpenTofu/Terraform to scale.

https://github.com/inmanta/inmanta-core.description: Inmanta is an automation and orchestration tool

https://github.com/leg100/otf.description: An open source alternative to terraform enterprise.

https://github.com/mage-ai/mage-ai.description: üßô Build, run, and manage data pipelines for integrating and transforming data.

https://github.com/rundeck/rundeck.description: Enable Self-Service Operations: Give specific users access to your existing tools, services, and scripts

https://github.com/terrakube-io/terrakub.description: Open source IaC Automation and Collaboration Software.

https://github.com/terramate-io/terramat.description: Open-source Infrastructure as Code (IaC) orchestration platform: GitOps workflows, orchestration, code generation, observability, drift detection, asset management, policies, Slack notifications, and more. Integrates with Terraform, OpenTofu, Terragrunt, Kubernetes, GitHub Actions, GitLab CI/CD, BitBucket Pipelines, and any other CI/CD platform.

https://github.com/terrateamio/terrateam.description: Terrateam is open-source GitOps infrastructure orchestration. It integrates with GitHub to automate Terraform, OpenTofu, CDKTF, Terragrunt, and Pulumi workflows through pull requests.

https://github.com/windmill-labs/windmil.description: Open-source developer platform to power your entire infra and turn scripts into webhooks, workflows and UIs. Fastest workflow engine (13x vs Airflow). Open-source alternative to Retool and Temporal.

https://github.com/workfloworchestrator/.description: The SURF ultimate Provider Agent (SuPA) implements the Connection Service (CS) version 2.1 protocol that enables the reservation, creation, management and removal of network circuits (connections) that transit several networks managed by different providers.
Example orchestrator UI based on the orchestrator-ui-library
Component library for the orchestrator-ui which is published in npm
Define JSON scheme with pydantic so a frontend can generate forms with pydantic validators

items.name: Netos NetOps
items.description: Built with Ansible Semaphore, the Netos NetOps project lays the foundation to install and manage NetBox, and other network tools.

summary.business_use_case: Deliver consistent development, test, and production network automation tooling, through automation.
summary.integration: Deploy Ansible, Python, and bash scripts to integrate with any computer system.
summary.use_case: A framework that makes it simple and fast to deploy and manage open-source enterprise networking applications and tools.

items.name: KnocKnoc
items.description: Knocknoc removes the attack surface of your existing infrastructure by providing access only to authorised users. It‚Äôs simple to implement and cost-effective at scale.

summary.integration: iptables/ipsets, haproxy, AWS, Azure, Palo, Fortigate, many more firewalls, webservers
summary.use_case: Allows SSO to open a port - for SSH bastion through to legacy apps, lock them down, let Knocknoc broker access

items.name: Dagster
items.description: Dagster is a data orchestrator for machine learning, analytics, and ETL. It provides a framework for building, testing, and deploying data pipelines with a focus on developer experience and operational excellence.

summary.business_use_case: Enables reliable and maintainable data pipelines with built-in testing, monitoring, and operational features for data-driven network automation
summary.integration: dbt, Apache Spark, Kubernetes, Docker, various databases and cloud services
summary.use_case: Data pipeline orchestration, ETL/ELT workflows, machine learning pipelines, network automation data processing

items.name: Prefect
items.description: Prefect is a workflow orchestration framework that makes it easy to build, run, and monitor data pipelines. It provides a Python-native approach to workflow automation with strong observability and error handling.

summary.business_use_case: Simplifies complex workflow management with robust error handling, retries, and monitoring for network automation and data processing
summary.integration: Kubernetes, Docker, AWS, Azure, GCP, dbt, various databases and APIs
summary.use_case: Workflow orchestration, data pipeline automation, network automation tasks, distributed computing

items.name: Mage.ai
items.description: Mage is an open-source data pipeline tool for transforming and integrating data. It provides a modern approach to building and deploying data pipelines with a focus on simplicity and developer experience.

summary.business_use_case: Accelerates data pipeline development with a visual interface and code-first approach for network data processing and automation
summary.integration: Various databases, cloud services, APIs, and data sources
summary.use_case: Data pipeline development, ETL/ELT workflows, data transformation, network telemetry processing

items.name: Apache Airflow
items.description: Apache Airflow is an open-source platform that allows for the programmatic creation, scheduling, and monitoring of workflows. It is widely used for orchestrating complex data pipelines and automating tasks across a wide range of industries.

summary.business_use_case: Airflow improves operational efficiency by automating tasks and ensuring seamless integration of data sources, enabling faster and more reliable delivery of insights.
summary.integration: Supports integration with databases, APIs, cloud services, and external systems to create a unified workflow environment.
summary.release_rate: Regular updates aligned with the latest advancements in data orchestration and cloud technologies.
summary.use_case: Orchestrating and scheduling data pipelines, managing ETL processes, and automating complex workflows across diverse environments.

items.name: Temporal
items.description: Temporal is a microservice orchestration platform that enables developers to build scalable and reliable applications using durable execution.

summary.business_use_case: Simplifies building reliable distributed systems and applications, reducing development time and improving system resilience
summary.integration: Supports various programming languages (Go, Java, PHP, TypeScript)
summary.release_rate: Regular releases with new features and improvements
summary.use_case: Microservice orchestration, workflow automation, distributed systems coordination

items.name: Windmill
items.description: Windmill is an open-source workflow engine and developer platform that turns scripts into auto-generated UIs, APIs, and workflows. Supporting 20+ languages including Python, TypeScript, Go, and Bash, it provides a code-first approach to automation with low-code visual workflow builders and comprehensive observability.

summary.business_use_case: Accelerates automation development by turning scripts into production-grade workflows and internal tools 10x faster, with high performance orchestration (13x faster than Airflow) and comprehensive observability
summary.integration: Webhooks, REST APIs, Slack, PostgreSQL, Git, VS Code, CLI tools, AWS, Azure, GCP, and 100+ integrations
summary.use_case: Script-to-workflow automation, internal tool building, API orchestration, scheduled jobs, and data pipeline management with auto-generated UIs and multi-language support

items.name: Semaphore UI
items.description: Semaphore UI is a powerful and user-friendly interface designed to manage Ansible automation projects efficiently. It provides a graphical user interface to simplify running, scheduling, and managing Ansible playbooks, making automation accessible to teams of all sizes.

summary.business_use_case: Semaphore UI increases efficiency in automation by providing a centralized tool to control and monitor Ansible playbook executions, reducing human errors and streamlining operational workflows.
summary.integration: Works seamlessly with Ansible playbooks, Git repositories for version control, and supports SSH-based connections to remote systems for task execution.
summary.release_rate: Regular updates to improve automation features and enhance user interface capabilities.
summary.use_case: Managing and scheduling Ansible playbooks through a simple and intuitive interface, helping teams automate infrastructure management and application deployment.

items.name: AWX
items.description: AWX is the open source upstream project for Red Hat Ansible Automation Platform. It provides a web-based user interface, REST API, and task engine for Ansible.

summary.business_use_case: Provides a user-friendly interface for managing Ansible automation, enabling easier adoption and management of automation across organizations
summary.integration: Ansible, Git, various cloud platforms
summary.use_case: Centralized automation management, team collaboration, audit trails

items.name: Red Hat Ansible Automation Platform
items.description: Red Hat Ansible Automation Platform is a foundation for building and operating automation at scale. It includes all the tools needed to implement enterprise-wide automation.

summary.business_use_case: Streamlines IT operations, reduces manual errors, and improves efficiency across complex environments
summary.integration: Red Hat OpenShift, VMware, AWS, Azure, Google Cloud
summary.release_rate: Quarterly updates with long-term support versions
summary.use_case: Enterprise-wide automation, compliance and governance, self-service IT

items.name: Gluware
items.description: Gluware is an intelligent network automation platform that enables organizations to automate and orchestrate multi-vendor, multi-domain networks at scale, reducing complexity and accelerating time-to-value.

summary.business_use_case: Reduces network complexity, improves agility, enhances security posture, and accelerates digital transformation through intelligent network automation
summary.integration: Supports multi-vendor environments and integrates with various IT service management and security tools
summary.release_rate: Regular releases for both on-premises and cloud versions
summary.use_case: Network automation, intent-based networking, configuration management, network discovery and inventory, and API-driven integrations

items.name: ZPE Systems
items.description: ZPE Systems provides innovative network infrastructure solutions, including the Nodegrid platform for out-of-band management, NetOps automation, and edge computing. Their solutions enable organizations to automate, secure, and manage critical network infrastructure.

summary.business_use_case: Enhances network resilience, improves operational efficiency, and enables secure remote management of distributed network infrastructure
summary.integration: Supports various network devices, cloud platforms, and IT management tools
summary.release_rate: Regular releases for hardware and software components
summary.use_case: Out-of-band management, NetOps automation, edge computing, network infrastructure automation and orchestration

items.name: IBM Concert Workflows (previously Pliant)
items.description: IBM Concert Workflows (previously Pliant) is a low-code automation platform that enables teams to quickly build, deploy, and scale workflows across IT operations, DevOps, and Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) functions. It provides a unified interface for automating complex processes across diverse technology stacks.

summary.business_use_case: Accelerates digital transformation by enabling rapid automation of complex IT processes, reducing manual errors, and improving operational efficiency
summary.integration: Supports integration with various IT systems, cloud platforms, and DevOps tools through pre-built actions and custom API integrations
summary.use_case: Low-code IT automation, workflow orchestration, API integration, and process automation for IT operations, DevOps, and SRE teams

items.name: Itential
items.description: Itential is an enterprise-grade network automation platform that enables network engineers and IT teams to automate complex network operations across multi-domain and multi-vendor environments. It provides low-code automation capabilities, pre-built network automations, and integrations with various network systems and IT tools.

summary.business_use_case: Accelerates network automation initiatives, reduces operational complexity, and improves network agility and reliability through low-code automation and pre-built network automations
summary.integration: Integrates with various network controllers, orchestrators, SDN platforms, cloud services, and IT service management tools
summary.use_case: Network automation, configuration management, network orchestration, and lifecycle management across multi-domain and multi-vendor environments

items.name: Spacelift
items.description: Spacelift is a sophisticated SaaS-delivered infrastructure management platform that enables infrastructure automation through software development practices.

summary.business_use_case: Streamlines infrastructure provisioning, enhances collaboration, and ensures compliance in cloud environments
summary.integration: Terraform, CloudFormation, Pulumi, Ansible
summary.use_case: GitOps workflows, collaborative infrastructure management, compliance enforcement

items.name: BackBox
items.description: BackBox is an intelligent automation platform that helps organizations manage complex networks by automating critical tasks such as configuration backup, compliance checks, and network inventory management.

summary.business_use_case: Improves network reliability, enhances security posture, and increases operational efficiency through automated network management and security tasks
summary.integration: Supports over 180 vendors and integrates with various security and network management tools
summary.release_rate: Regular releases for both on-premises and cloud versions
summary.use_case: Network configuration backup, compliance and vulnerability management, inventory management, and network automation

items.name: Rundeck
items.description: Rundeck is an open source automation service with a web console, command line tools, and API. It lets you easily run automation tasks across a set of nodes.

summary.business_use_case: Simplifies and automates routine IT tasks, reduces manual errors, and improves operational efficiency
summary.integration: Ansible, Terraform
summary.use_case: Self-service operations, incident management automation, routine task automation

items.name: StackStorm
items.description: StackStorm (aka "IFTTT for Ops") is event-driven automation for auto-remediation, incident responses, troubleshooting, deployments, and more for DevOps and SREs

items.name: Crosswork NSO
items.description: Cisco¬Æ Network Services Orchestrator (NSO) enabled by Tail-f¬Æ is an industry-leading orchestration platform for hybrid networks. It provides comprehensive lifecycle service automation to enable you to design and deliver high-quality services faster and more easily.

summary.business_use_case: Cisco NSO accelerates service delivery, enhances customer satisfaction, reduces operational costs, and increases scalability, driving business growth in dynamic and competitive markets.
summary.integration: Cisco, Juniper, Nokia, F5, Arista, Huawei, Ansible, VMware, Checkpoint, Fortinet, Palo Alto and more
summary.use_case: Cisco NSO automates network services, streamlines configuration, ensures compliance, and enhances multi-vendor operations, enabling rapid and efficient service delivery across hybrid networks.

items.name: Inmanta
items.description: Inmanta Service Orchestrator is a carrier-grade service orchestration and network automation platform that enables network engineers and IT teams to automate and manage the full lifecycle of network and IT services across multi-domain and multi-vendor environments.

summary.business_use_case: Scale network and service operations, accelerate service delivery, increase agility and productivity, improve compliance and resilience
summary.integration: Checkpoint, Cisco, FNT Software, Fortinet, Juniper, Kubernetes, NetBox, Nokia, VMware and more https://docs.inmanta.com/inmanta-service-orchestrator/7/reference/modules.html
summary.release_rate: 1 major release and several minor releases per year
summary.use_case: Network automation, configuration management, network service orchestration, and lifecycle management across multi-domain and multi-vendor environments

items.name: Nokia Event-Driven Automation (EDA)
items.description: Nokia Event-Driven Automation (EDA) is a cloud-native infrastructure automation platform with one goal of Human Error Zero. EDA creates multi-vendor networks so reliable that you can make changes without fear and move fast with confidence.

summary.business_use_case: Drive operational cost savings of up to 40 percent over four years, across all tasks associated with the data center fabric lifecycle while achieving human error zero through reliable, predictable network automation.
summary.integration: Integrates with leading cloud and workload management platforms like OpenShift, VMware, and OpenStack, enabling the network to respond to real-time compute demands. Also supports Microsoft Teams, WhatsApp, and Discord for event notifications.
summary.release_rate: Regular platform updates and feature releases
summary.use_case: Automates the entire data center network lifecycle from Day 0 design, Day 1 deployment, to Day 2 operations. EDA quickly responds to network conditions and triggers automated actions in response to specific events.

items.name: Workflow Orchestrator
items.description: The Workflow Orchestrator is a framework of tools that help the developer create workflow to modify the lifecycle of subscribed products. It is un-opinionated in what it can orchestrate, but very opinionated in how. The Orchestrator is designed to run linear workflows that represent the business process of delivering a product.

summary.business_use_case: Use a Service Provider Product model to orchestrator automated processes across your organization. Not limited to, but useful for deploying and tracking state of network configuration products, business and security processes.
summary.integration: Any system which exposes and API and can be reached or integrated via Python code
summary.use_case: Production ready Workflow Orchestration Framework to manage product lifecycle and workflows. Easy to use, Built on top of FastAPI

items.name: Open Terraforming Framework (OTF)
items.description: OTF is an open-source alternative to Terraform Enterprise, sharing many of its features including full Terraform CLI integration, remote execution mode, agent execution mode, remote state backend, SSO, RBAC, VCS integration, and compatibility with much of the Terraform Enterprise/Cloud API.

summary.business_use_case: Provides enterprise Terraform features including SSO, team management, agents, and no per-resource pricing, enabling organizations to manage infrastructure as code at scale without vendor lock-in
summary.integration: Terraform, OpenTofu, GitHub, OAuth
summary.use_case: Self-hosted Terraform Enterprise alternative, team collaboration, workspace management, remote state backend

items.name: Terragrunt
items.description: Terragrunt is a thin wrapper that provides extra tools for keeping your configurations DRY, working with multiple Terraform modules, and managing remote state.

summary.business_use_case: Reduces code duplication in Terraform configurations, simplifies multi-environment deployments, and provides better organization for complex infrastructure projects
summary.integration: Terraform, OpenTofu, AWS, Azure, GCP, various Terraform providers
summary.use_case: DRY Terraform configurations, remote state management, multi-module orchestration, dependency management

items.name: Terramate
items.description: Terramate is an open-source Infrastructure as Code (IaC) orchestration and code generation platform that helps teams simplify, scale, and automate Terraform, OpenTofu, Terragrunt, and other IaC tools. It provides stack-based infrastructure management, GitOps workflows, and seamless integration with existing CI/CD systems.

summary.business_use_case: Reduces Infrastructure as Code complexity and deployment times by up to 10x, improves DevOps velocity by up to 50%, and enables better collaboration through stack-based management and automated workflows
summary.integration: Terraform, OpenTofu, Terragrunt, Kubernetes, GitHub Actions, GitLab CI/CD, BitBucket Pipelines, Azure DevOps, Slack, and any CI/CD platform
summary.use_case: IaC orchestration, code generation, stack management, GitOps automation, and infrastructure lifecycle management for Terraform and OpenTofu

items.name: Terrakube
items.description: Terrakube is an open-source Infrastructure as Code (IaC) automation and collaboration platform that provides a comprehensive alternative to Terraform Enterprise and Terraform Cloud. Built with Kubernetes-native architecture, it enables teams to manage Terraform and OpenTofu workflows at scale with enterprise-grade features including remote state management, private registries, policy enforcement, and dynamic credential management.

summary.business_use_case: Provides enterprise Terraform management capabilities without vendor lock-in or licensing costs, enabling organizations to scale infrastructure as code with comprehensive governance, compliance, and collaboration features in a Kubernetes-native architecture
summary.integration: GitHub, GitLab, Azure DevOps, Bitbucket, Kubernetes, Helm, Azure Entra ID, Google Cloud Identity, Amazon Cognito, SAML/OIDC, OPA, Infracost, Terrascan
summary.release_rate: Regular releases with active development and community support
summary.use_case: Self-hosted Terraform/OpenTofu automation platform, team collaboration, workspace management, remote state backend, private module/provider registries

items.name: Scalr
items.description: Scalr is a Terraform and OpenTofu Automation and Collaboration (TACO) platform that provides a comprehensive remote operations backend with centralized state management, policy enforcement, and enterprise-grade governance features.

summary.business_use_case: Enables organizations to scale infrastructure as code with enterprise governance, cost control, and collaborative workflows while maintaining security and compliance
summary.integration: GitHub, GitLab, Azure DevOps, Bitbucket, Terraform, OpenTofu, AWS EventBridge, Datadog, Slack, Microsoft Teams, OPA, Checkov, Terragrunt
summary.use_case: Remote operations backend for Terraform and OpenTofu, team collaboration, workspace management, policy enforcement, cost controls

items.name: Atlantis
items.description: Atlantis is a tool for collaborating on Terraform through GitHub, GitLab and Bitbucket. It allows teams to review and approve Terraform changes through pull requests, enabling safer and more collaborative infrastructure changes. While pioneering GitOps workflows, it has significant scaling limitations and single-server architecture bottlenecks that make it unsuitable for large teams.

summary.business_use_case: Enables safe collaborative Terraform workflows through pull request-based reviews, reducing deployment risks and improving team coordination for infrastructure changes. However, scaling limitations and operational overhead make it less suitable for enterprise environments.
summary.integration: GitHub, GitLab, Bitbucket, Terraform, Slack, webhooks, various CI/CD systems
summary.use_case: Terraform pull request automation, collaborative infrastructure changes, Terraform plan/apply workflow automation for small to medium teams

items.name: Digger
items.description: Digger is an open-source Infrastructure as Code orchestration tool that runs Terraform natively in your existing CI/CD pipeline. Unlike traditional TACOS that require separate infrastructure, Digger leverages your existing CI compute, orchestration, and logging while providing Terraform plan/apply automation through pull request comments, drift detection, and policy enforcement.

summary.business_use_case: Reduces infrastructure costs and complexity by running Terraform in existing CI rather than separate TACOS infrastructure, while maintaining security by keeping cloud secrets within your CI environment
summary.integration: GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, Bitbucket Pipelines, Azure DevOps, Terraform, OpenTofu, Terragrunt, AWS, GCP, Azure, OPA, Checkov
summary.use_case: Terraform CI/CD in existing pipelines, pull request automation, drift detection, policy enforcement without dedicated infrastructure

items.name: Terrateam
items.description: Terrateam is an open-source GitOps infrastructure orchestration platform that automates Terraform, OpenTofu, CDKTF, Terragrunt, and Pulumi workflows through GitHub and GitLab pull requests. Built with OCaml for performance and type safety, it provides enterprise-grade features including OIDC authentication, policy enforcement, and unlimited parallel execution while maintaining GitHub-native simplicity.

summary.business_use_case: Enables secure, scalable infrastructure as code workflows with enterprise governance while maintaining operational simplicity and predictable costs through flat-rate pricing instead of resource-based fees
summary.integration: GitHub, GitLab, Terraform, OpenTofu, CDKTF, Terragrunt, Pulumi, AWS OIDC, GCP Workload Identity, Azure, OPA, Conftest
summary.use_case: GitHub-native Terraform automation, pull request workflows, drift detection, policy enforcement, multi-workspace orchestration

items.name: NORFAB (Network Automation Fabric)
items.description: NORFAB is a framework for extreme network automations that acts as a glue bringing network automation tools together.

summary.business_use_case: Simplify and enhance network automation, empower engineers, address mundane tasks
summary.integration: Nornir, Netbox, NAPALM, SCRAPLI, ROBOT, Containerlab, Netmiko, FastAPI etc.
summary.use_case: Network configuration, network testing, network reporting
